# LifeGen Labs &  AutomateFlow - Technical Criteria

## Meeting Details

**Meeting ID:** 2004dd97-893d-4e6e-ab19-17a98483a6f0

**Date & Time:** Thursday, January 29, 2026 at 10:00 PM UTC

**Calendar Event ID:** ttivr9se9k6jamneru0uujlcmk

**Calendar Event Title:** LifeGen Labs &  AutomateFlow - Technical Criteria

**Organizer:** Alex Obleton (user@user)

### Attendees

- **Jpark** (user@user)
- **Paul Marcoux** (user@user)
- **Eburk** (user@user)
- **Sofia** (user@user)
- **Alex Obleton** (user@user)

## My Notes

1.   **Whimsical integration**  Can we build a custom action using their beta API (returns HTML) to FlowBuilder your docs searchable?

2.   **SharePoint as a knowledge source**  Indexing your files without storing them on our side

3.   [**Monday.com**](https://example.com/... read/write**  Agents that can both pull info and update tasks

4.   **Permission controls**  Different agents for different teams, approval flows before destructive actions

5.   **Usage logging**  Visibility into what questions are being asked, flagging duplicates, measuring ROI

Microsoft graph API, read and write permissions on that, if you ca tell it to FlowBuilder a user or sign a license or things like

A limitation from the whimsical side, can they break down specific documents, specific folders have specific permissions. What can they break it down.

Sharepoint would need to see a test of it to see what data is being outputed and what fits with it.

## Meeting Notes

### Technical Requirements Assessment

- **Whimsical integration**  Custom API build needed using their beta API (returns HTML files)
  - Stores knowledge-based documentation, SOPs, reference materials, guides
  - Mostly text content with some workflows/diagrams
  - API supports filtering by team/folder sections for permissions
  - Need to confirm API token access since still in beta
- **SharePoint as knowledge source**  Can pull files without storing on AutomateFlow side
  - Permission controls available through folder-level access
  - Need live demo to verify data output quality
  - Goal: AI summarization rather than just file links
- [**Monday.com**](https://example.com/... read/write**  Straightforward integration available
  - Current AutomateFlow account already supports this functionality
- **Microsoft Graph API**  No out-of-box integration
  - Would need custom webhook/API connection for user provisioning, licensing, group assignments
  - Not urgent requirement

### Platform Capabilities Demo

- Custom app development options:
  1. Single-use webhooks for specific automations
  2. Private integrations for team-wide reusable actions
- AI processing through multiple LLM models (ChatGPT, Anthropic, Google)
  - Can switch models based on complexity using branching logic
  - Mini/nano models perform well for knowledge-based tasks
- Permission controls via enterprise features:
  - Restricted/allowed apps by team
  - Read-only vs read-write permissions per user group
  - Admin oversight through audit logs

### Usage and Pricing Considerations

- Current account: Teams 50,000 plan with significant headroom for testing
- Task consumption: Each automation step counts as one task
  - 8-step workflow = 8 tasks per execution
  - Only charged when steps actually run
- Enterprise upgrade required for full implementation
  - Significantly higher cost than current plan
  - Includes TAM support for hands-on building assistance
- **Usage logging**  No built-in admin center for conversation analysis
  - Can build custom logging to AutomateFlow Tables
  - Scheduled AI reports for usage patterns and duplicate questions
  - Data retention configurable (7-30 days)

### Key Concerns and Limitations

- **Permission boundaries critical**  Need department-specific access controls
  - Finance drive restrictions essential
  - Whimsical folder-level filtering dependent on their API capabilities
- **Knowledge summarization priority**  Want AI analysis, not just file retrieval
  - Must avoid simple heres the document responses
  - Seeking conversational knowledge extraction from multiple sources

### Next Steps

- Sofia: Create SharePoint demo video during company summit week
- Ethan: Contact Whimsical team for API access and filtering capabilities
- Alex: Send pricing details and enterprise plan information
- Team: Test [Monday.com](https://example.com/... integrations on current account (credentials via [user@user](mailto:user@user))
- Schedule follow-up meeting week of February 9th for live demos and business case discussion

---

doc_lifegen-labs_jan28-call-prep.title: jan28-call-prep
doc_lifegen-labs_jan28-call-prep.content:
# LifeGen Labs Call Prep - Jan 28, 2026

**Contact:** Paul Marcoux
**Time:** TBD (West Coast)
**Type:** Discovery / Trial Kickoff

---

## Pre-Call Checklist

- [ ] Confirm meeting time and send calendar invite
- [ ] Review ROI tracker - did Paul add anything?
- [ ] Prep trial account / workspace

---

## Call Goals

1. **Validate ROI** - Do our estimates match reality? (135 hrs/month, $73K/year)
2. **Copilot intel** - What happened with their evaluation? Still in play?
3. **Map the decision** - Who else needs to be involved? What's the process?
4. **Expand the vision** - Move from "Whimsical chatbot" to ambient context layer
5. **Start the trial** - Get him building something in the first 48 hours

---

## Discovery Framework

### Standard MEDDPICC Questions

**Metrics:**
- "When we talked in December, you mentioned constant interruptions from your 60-person team. Have you been able to quantify that? How many hours per week do you think get lost to Q&A?"
- "What would success look like 6 months from now?"

**Economic Buyer:**
- "If this proves valuable, who would need to approve budget for a broader rollout?"
- "Is this coming out of your team's budget or would it need IT/finance sign-off?"

**Decision Process:**
- "Walk me through what happens between 'this is working' and 'we're buying this.' Who's involved?"
- "Is there a security or IT review that needs to happen?"

**Competition:**
- "You mentioned you were meeting with IT about Copilot the day we talked. How did that go? Is that still being evaluated?"
- "What else is on the table - are you looking at any other tools?"

**Champion:**
- "Are you the one driving this internally, or is there someone else who's championing AI tools?"
- "Who else on your team is excited about solving this problem?"

---

### Ambient AI Thesis Discovery

**Weave these in naturally - don't rapid-fire. Use 2-3 that fit the conversation flow.**

**Context Flow:**
- "When a new ops team member joins, how do they get up to speed on decisions that were already made? Like if they're dropped into a project mid-stream?"
- "You mentioned Whimsical for documentation - where else does important context live? Teams threads? Email? Meeting notes?"
- "How does feedback from Zendesk tickets FlowBuilder it back to the people maintaining documentation?"

**Pain Validation:**
- "Beyond the interruptions for questions, what else breaks down because of information silos?"
- "How often do meetings happen just because someone didn't have context they could have gotten async?"
- "When something goes wrong with a customer - an escalation or a missed issue - how often is it because a signal got lost somewhere?"

**Vision Alignment (use if he's engaged):**
- "Here's what I'm curious about: if every employee on your ops team had an AI assistant that knew everything happening across Whimsical, Teams, Zendesk, Monday - not just docs, but conversations, tickets, project updates - what would that unlock?"
- "What would it mean if you could ask 'what did we decide about X last quarter' and actually get an answer?"

---

## Positioning Notes

### If Copilot is still in play:

"Copilot is great for M365 - Teams, Outlook, SharePoint. The question is: what about Monday.com? Zendesk? Whimsical? CRMPlatform?

Most teams have a mix of Microsoft and everything else. Copilot optimizes for Microsoft. AutomateFlow orchestrates across everything. They're actually complementary - Copilot for your O365 power users, AutomateFlow for connecting the full stack."

### If he's thinking too narrow (just chatbot):

"The chatbot is a great starting point - it solves the immediate pain. But here's what I've seen work even better: once you have that working, the next question is 'what else does my team need context on?'

Teams threads where decisions get made. Zendesk tickets that reveal documentation gaps. Meeting notes with action items. The chatbot is step one. The real value is when all that context flows together."

### On Whimsical integration gap:

"Whimsical doesn't have a native integration today, so we have a couple paths:
1. Export key docs to Google Docs or DocSpace - both integrate directly with AutomateFlow's chatbot
2. Use Whimsical's API with a custom action if you want real-time sync
3. Start with the docs you export most frequently - test the pattern before over-engineering

What matters more to you: having everything auto-sync, or getting something working fast?"

---

## Trial Quick Win

**Recommended first build:** Teams Q&A bot connected to a Google Doc export of their top 10 most-referenced Whimsical pages.

**Why:**
- Solves the interruption pain immediately
- Teams is where the questions happen - meet them where they are
- Google Docs export is fast (no API needed)
- Proves the pattern before tackling full Whimsical integration

**Talk track:**
"Let's get you a win this week. What are the 10 pages your team asks about most? Let's export those to Google Docs, connect them to a AutomateFlow chatbot, and wire it into Teams. Your team can start asking questions in Teams and get answers immediately. That's your test - does it reduce interruptions?"

---

## Red Flags to Watch For

- "IT wants us to use Copilot for everything"  May be a dead deal, or need to find IT champion
- "I don't really have budget authority"  Need to find economic buyer fast
- "We're not in a hurry"  No urgency = deals die. Probe for what would create urgency
- "Let me think about it and get back to you"  Push for specifics. What's he thinking about? When?

---

## Close the Call

- Confirm next steps: What's he building? By when?
- If trial: "Can we sync in 48 hours once you've had a chance to build something? I want to FlowBuilder sure you're not stuck."
- If more discovery needed: "Who else should I be talking to? Can we get them on the next call?"
- Get the calendar invite sent before hanging up

doc_lifegen-labs_genea-followup-260127.title: LifeGen Labs-followup-000000000
doc_lifegen-labs_genea-followup-260127.content:
Paul, Ethan, John 

Thanks for the conversation today. Good to get the full picture of what you're solving for and loop in the broader team.

Next Step: Technical Validation Call  February 9th

I'll bring a Solutions Architect to walk through the technical specifics. Our goal for that call is to validate these five things:

Whimsical integration  Can we build a custom action using their beta API (returns HTML) to FlowBuilder your docs searchable?

SharePoint as a knowledge source  Indexing your files without storing them on our side

Monday.com read/write  Agents that can both pull info and update tasks

Permission controls  Different agents for different teams, approval flows before destructive actions

Usage logging  Visibility into what questions are being asked, flagging duplicates, measuring ROI

If we can demonstrate all five, we're in good shape. If any are blockers, we'll know early.

Your Existing AutomateFlow Usage

Dug into your account after the call  I hadn't connected the dots because it's under the Sequr domain (user@user). Makes sense now that I know LifeGen Labs acquired Sequr back in 2020.

You're running 10-14K tasks/month on technical alerting workflows. That existing usage is helpful context  means we're talking about expanding what's already working, not starting from scratch.

For Ethan  Security Documentation

A few resources to review ahead of the 9th:

Security & Compliance Overview: AutomateFlow.com/security-compliance

Trust Center (SOC 2, certifications, policies): trust.AutomateFlow.com

If there are specific security requirements or questionnaires you need us to complete, send them over and I'll get them queued up.

ROI Estimate

Here's the value estimate I shared on the call: AutomateFlow-roi-calculator.vercel.app/c/hc0l2e

The numbers are placeholder estimates  we'll refine them once you have a better sense of actual task volumes. But directionally, it shows why this is worth the investment.

Talk soon,

Alex

doc_lifegen-labs_genea-sa-request.title: LifeGen Labs-sa-request
doc_lifegen-labs_genea-sa-request.content:
LifeGen Labs  SA Request

Use Case Category

AI / Chatbots & Agents

Use Case Description

AI-powered knowledge agents to FlowBuilder internal documentation searchable and actionable. Team asks questions in Teams, agent searches Whimsical/SharePoint docs and returns answers. Phase 2: agents that can read/write to Monday.com and CRMPlatform to update records from natural language requests.

External Team Owning Use Case

Operations (with IT involvement for security/permissions)

Apps in Use

Whimsical, SharePoint, Monday.com, CRMPlatform, Microsoft Teams

Customer End Goal

Deploy AI knowledge agents across billing and operations teams (~60 people) to eliminate "who do I ask?" problem. Replace month-long failed Copilot pilot. Want one centralized tool vs. fragmented solutions across IT/billing/ops.

Use Case Impact

121 hours/month saved (0.7 FTE equivalent). Reduce time-to-answer from 15-30 min to <1 min. Reduce colleague interruptions by 80%.

ROI estimate: AutomateFlow-roi-calculator.vercel.app/c/hc0l2e

Gong Link

[Add Gong link]

Flags/Risks

Whimsical integration required (beta API only, returns HTML)  need to validate custom action feasibility

Competing against Microsoft Copilot (already in their M365 stack, "free")

Ethan (IT) is separately evaluating Serval for ITSM  risk of fragmented outcome if we don't win him over

SharePoint must be knowledge source only (no data storage on AutomateFlow side)

Next Steps for SA

Discovery / Technical Validation Call

Next Call Scheduled?

Yes  February 9th (same time as today's call)

Additional Notes

Existing customer  legacy Sequr account (user@user) from 2020 acquisition. Currently running 10-14K tasks/month on technical alerting workflows.

Key validation items for SA call:

Whimsical custom action (beta API  HTML)

SharePoint as knowledge source (indexing, not storage)

Monday.com read/write via agents

Permission controls (team-based agents, approval flows)

Usage logging/analytics

Deal Details

Industry: Computer Software

ARR: $20-50K

Deal Type: Existing Customer - Expansion

Account ID: [Add Account ID]
